meanings.definition: To follow a winding or indirect course.
meanings.sent1: The stream will meander through the forest.
meanings.sent2: I like to meander through the park on my walks.
meanings.sent3: The lost puppy decided to meander around the neighborhood.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts would meander like a lazy river.
meanings.sent5: The butterfly seemed to meander aimlessly in the garden.

meanings.definition: A winding curve or bend in a river or road.
meanings.sent1: The river's meander created a beautiful view.
meanings.sent2: We drove along the scenic meander of the road.
meanings.sent3: The meander in the path made the journey more interesting.
meanings.sent4: The meander of the river resembled a graceful dance.
meanings.sent5: The meander of the road led us to unexpected discoveries.
